original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields down in mid-day trade, rupee at 327/328.50 against the US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s treasury bond yields were down at mid-day trading on Wednesday and the rupee opened weaker in the spot market as results of a bill auction is awaited, dealers said.
A 15.09.2027 bond was quoted at 28.10/60 percent, up from 28.25/29.00 percent from Tuesday.
Sri Lanka rupee was trading at 327/328.50 rupees against the US dollar weakened, from 325/328 rupees from a day earlier. (Colombo/ March29/2023)
